content.description: Climb the furthest right route on the wall heading straight up to the crux which occurs at the last bolt.
content.location: It is the rightmost route on The Solarium.

content.description: Fire up the crack, and mantle the ledge to a sit down rest. Jugs lead to a few thin moves and a fun move to the top. It looks like some people my start out left and rail up the diagonal crack to the 2nd bolt. There is some good climbing on good rock, but the route's proximity to its easier neighbor makes it feet contrived, and I wasn't sure what jugs should be off.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the wall.

content.description: Move left into the crux flake, and then rail up the last bit of the diagonal crack to a sit-down rest. It is a jug haul from the ledge to the anchors. This is a fun route that may seem easier if you know how to hand jam.
content.location: This is the 2nd bolt line from the left.

content.description: Make some interesting moves up the diagonal crack and geode hueco to a sit down rest. Follow some more diagonal cracks up to some face moves at the top. This one is a little more sustained and hard to read than its neighbor to the left. The clipping jugs are good but felt small when I got to them. I wound up topping out and then downclimbing to the anchor after shaking out a bit.
content.location: This is the 2nd route from the right.
